Replace.Text: Yes! It is better for our people to travel side-by-side than for them to walk alone.
While we were close before, the Cree must travel their own trail now.
All my life, I have sought peace between peoples. Let our alliance show others a better path.
This is very good!
Perhaps one day you will realize that both our people were stronger when we were united.
Truly, India has long thought the same of your people. To declare so publicly is a privilege.
My people do not share my enthusiasm for our friendship. But they may warm to you, one day.
India thinks highly of your people. With your permission, I will declare our mutual friendship to all.
I can respect that.
The fault was mine. Forgive me.
I quite enjoyed hosting your delegation. They gave me much to consider of our mutual future.
Though I would be delighted to greet your delegation, I am occupied elsewhere. Another time!
Our delegation brings many gifts. Drink all the spiced buttermilk you desire! We can always send more.
Though I ignore your cruel words, India will long remember them.
You are an embarrassment to your people! You speak with two mouths, neither of them pleasant. (Denounces You).
You are welcome to speak.
India sees your future as neither rival nor future vassal, but instead as a true partner. What do you say?
Our people have spilled enough blood—yours and mine both. Let us end this war for their sake.
Is this a jest? No.
It is past time to retire our forces from the battlefield. You must see the wisdom in this.
I humbly accept your request. India has much to gain from such an arrangement.
I cannot. For now, India's borders must remain closed to you.
Opening your borders would help bring your people closer to mine. I would, of course, reciprocate.
I don't believe your army intended to threaten India. Still, it is best they withdraw. Immediately.
You learned my own lessons far too well. I instructed you in my own demise.
No. India would not benefit.
A wise proposal!
The world will know we lead two peoples with one will.
Mapuche are not prepared for this friendship. Perhaps in time we will be.
One will; two peoples. Should we tell the world we stand as friends?
Yes, good.
This leaves an ill taste in my mouth.
I thank you for your delegation. Mapuche welcome them as honored visitors.
Your delegation may not enter Mapuche cities.
Mapuche send gifts. The cloth is our finest work. The charquicán is delicious. Please accept these.
Your deeds reflect your true nature. The Mapuche cannot stand you!
Mapuche use your name as a curse. Who can stand with you? Your friends turn their backs to you. (Denounces You).
Ah, it's you.
I know now that you are worthy. Mapuche invite you to stand with us.
Mapuche have no more stomach for this war.
I cannot.
This war binds us to a destructive path. Let us instead walk freely.
You are welcome to cross Mapuche land.
This land is for Mapuche alone. You must go elsewhere.
Mapuche wish to travel your lands, just as you would wish to travel ours.
Mapuche think your armies intend us harm. I will give you a chance to set our minds at ease.
We resisted to the last, but it was too late … too late.
You offend me.
You honor Mapuche with this.
I am happiest making peace between nations. Friendship between our people brings me joy.
It is good that you wish to be friends with the Cree, but my people are not ready. Not now.
The Cree are ready to welcome you as friends. Please, I ask you, honor their trust.
Good, good.
This is not what I wanted.
My people welcomed your delegation to our council fires.
No, my people do not wish for gifts such as these.
My people send you gifts—buffalo robes and pimihkan. With these you will last through winter.
You word is worthless, your people go astray, and you have no friends who will stand by you.
I swear to protect my people from the likes of you. Your lies pollute the air. You live only to steal. (Denounces You).
You are welcome.
Long have the Cree made allies of our friends. Will you be the next to join us?
From an unjust war may come a whole peace between us.
No, this is untenable.
I have always wanted peace. Can our peoples find a way to walk this path?
There is room enough for your people to cross our lands.
The Cree do not trust you. Please keep to your lands.
My people wish to cross your lands. Will you allow them?
Why do you send so many armies near our borders? A single rash act, and peace would be broken.
Had I wanted war, I would not be here now. You did not catch me. I gave myself up.
A fool would accept this. I am no fool.
I see the wisdom in this. Agreed.
What a happy day! We will stand together as one, like the two arms of the saltire.
I think you're the right sort, but Scotland still has their reservations about you. Not now.
In a world of seething backbiters, fair-minded folk must unite as friends.
Magnificent.
No, I understand.
I've received your delegation and treated them to a cèilidh. We danced until the roosters crowed!
Scotland would rather have true words from you than fair gifts, so I've sent your delegation back.
Please accept my people's finest tweeds and haggis. Oh, and hark to the pipers! Are they not grand?
You reeking midden! You crooked broker of worthless words! Get out of my sight!
You feckless idiot! I'd brain you with an axe, but I'm afraid your thick pate'd shatter it. (Denounces You).
Go on, speak.
We're much alike, you and I. Take my hand, and let us show the world we stand allied!
Scotland enjoys knocking your forces about, but enough is enough.
Of course not!
Let's speak plain. No "mutual disengagement, cessation of hostilities, et cetera." Truce, or not?
That's fair. Mind you don't knock the pasture walls as you cross them.
You can't just come and roam about.
A good neighbor is one who lets a man cross his fields, wouldn't you agree?
Your troops should not parade outside Scotland's territory. Best move them away.
A lonely wind blows through the highlands today. A dirge for Scotland. Can you it hear?
What a shabby offer. No.
Hmm. Agreed.
Korea gladly accepts your declaration. I was about to ask the same of you.
I cannot accept your declaration. To do so would cause more trouble for Korea than its worth.
I feel I must declare Korea's friendship with your people. With your agreement, of course.
How wonderful.
It is not to be, then.
We are grateful to receive your delegation. We welcome the gifts you provided.
Korea is wary of receiving a gift until we know the intentions of its benefactor.
Please accept our delicious yukpo. The soy keeps the beef tender and flavorful.
Korea has done nothing to deserve your vile insults! But now, perhaps we shall.
You are the ocean's offal—your stink clings to everything you touch. (Denounces You).
You may speak.
Korea's allies are its strength. We would both be stronger together.
I will betray my desire to defeat you in return for a lasting peace. That, I shall not betray.
Out of the question.
This war has become a distraction for us both. Let us disengage and attend to our people.
I welcome the trade and exchange of ideas that comes with open borders.
It is prudent to keep our borders closed to you until your intentions are clear.
Despite the prudence of caution, open borders could do well to improve our relations.
Korea does not appreciate the soldiers near our borders. Withdraw them immediately.
I foresaw my own end, but not that Korea would share my fate.
Thank you, but I cannot agree.
An appealing offer. Korea shall agree.
Eagles soar above doves and rabbits. Let us stand in friendship, and the rest can cower in our shadow.
No. Don't assume Mongolia admires you that much.
Accept Mongolia's friendship! I want to see the world tremble when they learn we are united.
Mongolia will appreciate this.
Mongolia will remember this.
My riders escorted your delegation to safety and distributed your gifts. They were adequate.
Your gifts are unnecessary. If I wanted those things, I would take them.
I am sending you gifts—surplus horses, a youth's bow, and airag to fortify you. Drink up!
Foolish and feeble! How have you not been conquered yet?
Your weakness and folly anger me. One day, perhaps soon, you will learn the danger in that. (Denounces You).
I shall weigh your words.
Ride with Mongolia. You know your heart yearns for this alliance.
Though I prefer to continue this fight, Mongolia does not.
Not if you added your finest horse.
We both know Mongolia will defeat you. Let us suspend this war. For now.
You may cross our lands. Marvel at our strengths as you pass through.
What is ours is ours, whether it be herds or lands.
I want you to let my forces travel across your land.
The armies you have near our borders are a tempting target. For their safety, you should move them.
You have hobbled the Mongolian clans. My respect for you nearly matches the loathing.
You call it a deal. I call it robbery.
Agreed. Best for both of us.
Of course! The children of Zulu respect your people, and you have proven yourself a true friend.
You are no true friend to the children of Zulu. With more effort, you could be, but now? No.
The children of Zulu will stand with you, if you stand with them. Shall we declare our friendship?
I am not beyond gratitude.
Do not mock me.
Your delegation arrived. The children of Zulu welcome your gifts, but do not think to purchase loyalty.
Until I know your measure, I can accept no gift you provide.
I sent a ceremonial iklwa. They're named for the sound they make when pulled from wounds.
Your words are foul. You have a rot at your center. The only way to cleanse that is to cut it out.
A weak body can train. A weak mind can learn. But as you reveal, there is no cure for a weak heart. (Denounces You).
You again.
The differences amongst our people mean nothing. Will you fight by our side? This is all that matters.
If you seek peace, the children of Zulu will accept your request.
You waste my time.
This war destroys us both. Any victory would be hollow. Come, let us stay our weapons.
Agreed. It is better to see your neighbor's strength than imagine weakness.
The children of Zulu have no use for your people blundering through our lands.
The children of Zulu have nothing to hide. Your people are welcome within our lands.
The troops you march along Zulu borders make a tempting target for my impi.
True, you ended my reign. But I will live on in your nightmares.
Do not mock me.
Yes—for now.
I thought this a cruel jest, but upon reflection, I note your sincerity. Georgia agrees to your request.
Friendship? Georgia is many things, but not one involves being your friend.
You number amongst the few Georgia can trust. Should you agree, I will let it be known to all.
Your actions are worthy of my gratitude.
You are impossible.
Your delegation did not cause an incident. I consider that a success.
Georgia has pressing matters. This is no time to host your merchants.
Georgian merchants bring many strings of churchkhela. They make a filling dessert.
You are a detestable person. Your people deserve a better leader than you.
To call you a thoughtless cur is an insult to curs. (Denounces You).
Why have you disturbed me?
Combining our strength shall give our mutual enemies pause. Presuming you see the benefit.
I am satisfied you learned your lesson. This war may end.
Regrettable. Deeply regrettable.
This war must end. I will admit no fault in its cause.
I suppose it will encourage trade between our peoples. Georgia shall open its borders. For now.
Georgia does not need foreign influence in its lands. At least, not yours.
My advisors recommend Georgia opens its borders. I see some wisdom in their words.
You test my patience with soldiers along Georgian borders. Remove them or they shall be removed.
Walls weren't enough to save Georgia from ruin. Neither was I.
Try again. This time, with a real offer.
It pains me to agree, but I must.
We are greatly pleased to accept the hand of friendship. May our future be long and prosperous!
We do not recognize your claim of friendship with the Netherlands.
Civilizations with such friendly relations as ours should proclaim this to the world, wouldn't you agree?
Wonderful.
How unfortunate.
We have welcomed your delegates with appropriate honors, and we thank you.
It is inappropriate for us to accept your gifts, as I am sure you understand.
The Netherlands send you gifts of greeting—wooden shoes, cheeses, and some delightful stroopwafel.
We give you the benefit of our frank opinion: That you are unfit to rule, and a threat to the Netherlands.
It is our fervent desire to tell you just how awful we find you, and we wish your reign to be brief. (Denounces You).
You have our attention.
You have proven a reliable partner in our nation's cause, and we seek to deepen this relationship.
Yes. Our fight has gone on long enough. Let us rebuild what we have lost.
Simply impossible.
The Netherlands would rather trade goods than blows. We should end this war, immediately.
The Netherlands is pleased to accept your proposal and will open our borders to you.
We cannot allow you to cross our lands freely.
Would not our interests be best served by opening travel between our lands?
Do you think us unaware of your plans? We demand you move your troops from our borders at once!
With God's help, may the Netherlands one day reclaim its territory.
We must decline.
We have heard no better offer.
The best neighbors are distant ones. Right now, you are India's best neighbor.
There is no distance between our lands. My people are forced to endure the stench of your own.
Your people take great pride in where they come from. It is clear they follow your lead.
How do you lead such a boring people? Do they follow the example you set?
I have great respect for those who declare their friendships to the world.
Choose your friendships wisely—but you must choose.
Wise to keep peace with your neighbors. Blood feuds are paid at great expense.
Keep your wars distant. Otherwise you track the muck through your own lands.
Your mastery of creation's secrets is the envy of my people.
While others reach for the heavens, you claw at the dirt.
The cavalry you field is an embarrassment, but thankfully a small one.
You wouldn't wear a sheep's bladder and call it a helmet. So why claim you have amassed "cavalry?"
The armies you field reveal your strength. Did you purge the rabble? Always wise to purge the rabble.
Why allow your forces to keep their identity? They should band together to serve one will—yours.
I appreciate the walls you build for your people. You have a Georgian spirit.
Your people are too trusting. They'll let anyone into their cities—even barbarians.
The Netherlands flourishes with every shipment you send to us.
Those who refuse trade often think they can take what they want from us. They are sorely mistaken.
I am Chandragupta, Mauryan emperor of unified India. No, it has not gone to my head.
I am Lautaro, the Swift Hawk. Mapuche honor me with respect. Will I see the same from you?
I am Poundmaker, and I represent the Cree. May there always be peace between us.
I am Robert the Bruce. Scotland follows me—be it through fields of wheat or of battle.
I, Seondeok of Korea, acknowledge you. Our meeting was foreseen.
I am Genghis Khan. Before me lie future Mongolian lands. Behind me is the only cavalry that matters.
You stand before Shaka of the Zulu. Dare you turn your back to my armies? I will make no such mistake.
I am Tamar of Georgia. Say what you will and be on your way.
I am Wilhelmina, Queen of the Netherlands. It is my great pleasure to finally meet you.
You travel near Indian territory. Why not visit and relax at our grand stepwells?
You approach Mapuche land. Do you seek to walk among our chemamull, and learn of our ancestors?
I invite you to come as my guest and see how the Cree live.
While you're in the neighborhood, wouldn't you want to see our capital?
You must visit our capital. Our seowon are the finest examples of scientific and political thought.
Do you know whose lands you approach? See the Keshik gather, and know that this is Mongolia.
You must travel to the Zulu capital. There is strength in our ikanda—which you should see for yourself.
I shall direct you to our capital. Behold our highly defensible tsikhe.
The Netherlands welcomes you to learn of our capital, and invite you to reciprocate.
Only a fool could decline.
You honor Mapuche with this.
I see the wisdom in this. Agreed.
Can't say no to that.
An appealing offer. Korea shall agree.
I can accept this.
Acceptable.
Very well.
We express our gratitude.
We should speak of our capitals. Determine just how far we are from one another.
I will tell you of the capital of Mapuche, if you will tell me of your capital.
Come and see where my people live, and show us where you call home.
I've a mind to take a look at your capital. And as I'm a fair man, I'll bring you to see Scotland's.
I will provide directions to our capital, should you reciprocate.
We should exchange information on our capitals. Someday I may want to visit you.
I can direct you to the Zulu capital, if you direct me to yours. A risk to share, yes—but a small one.
We should provide directions to our capitals so we may deal with each other directly.
We desire to trade the location of our capital cities, to our mutual and lasting benefit.
(You are not trading with them.)
(Your science output is woeful.)
(You are fighting with your neighbors.)
(Your use of corps/armies is pathetic.)
(Your cavalry is too competitive.)
(You do not have enough alliances.)
(Your borders are too close to him.)
(You aren't building enough walls.)
(You are losing cities due to lack of loyalty.)
India does not fear war. The most you can do is slow our rightful advance.
I knew you could not be trusted! We have long prepared for this war. Have you?
You could have found another way. Now, your regrets will be measured in blood.
You gormless radger! You'll dine on your own teeth before you set foot in Scotland!
Your defeat shall be swift … your people, forgotten. This I have foreseen.
No more words. Today, Mongolia charges toward your defeat.
Strong words, but they quaver on your lips. Already I see you weaken in fear.
Georgian hearts will not tremble before your multitudes.
Your treacherous aggression shall not succeed. The Netherlands resists!
Your territory could be much improved under Indian rule. Best I see it through.
It comes to war. Mapuche shall use your own weapons against you!
I do not care to inflict the terrors of war upon you—but justice requires it.
War lingers in our hearts. Why carry on with a false peace?
The stars predict your defeat. Why argue with the heavens?
You stand in the way of my armies. Soon, you shall fall before them.
There is too much weakness in you. Fear not—the children of Zulu shall remove it.
God fights with us. You stand alone.
The Netherlands does not fear you. When we defeat you, we will be stronger than ever.
